paper_title.en: High-field transport in semiconductors by transmission formalism

description.en:
High field transport in semiconductor is investigated by the transmission-reflection formalism. One-dimensional Boltzmann transport equation (BTE) is solved, without resorting to the relaxation time approximation as well as to the perturbation expansion. In case of elastic scattering without energy relaxation, the current density is proportional to square root of the electric field for a wide range of field. By inclusion of the energy relaxation due to the optical phonon emission, the current density restored the proportionality to electric field, and showed a tendency of saturation in high-field. The saturation in the high-field is concluded to be due to the ballistic transmission of carriers through a specific layer located at the beginning of channel. © 2008 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH &amp
 Co. KGaA.

publication_name.en: Physica Status Solidi (C) Current Topics in Solid State Physics

paper_title.en: High-field transport in semiconductors by transmission formalism

description.en: High field transport in semiconductor is investigated by the transmission-reflection formalism. One-dimensional Boltzmann transport equation (BTE) is solved, without resorting to the relaxation time approximation as well as to the perturbation expansion. In case of elastic scattering without energy relaxation, the current density is proportional to square root of the electric field for a wide range of field. By inclusion of the energy relaxation due to the optical phonon emission, the current density restored the proportionality to electric field, and showed a tendency of saturation in high-field. The saturation in the high-field is concluded to be due to the ballistic transmission of carriers through a specific layer located at the beginning of channel. (C) 2008 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. paper_title.en: Numerical study on ballistic n(+)-i-n(+) diode by Monte Carlo simulation: Influence of energy relaxation of hot electrons in drain region on ballistic transport

description.en: We have investigated the effects of elastic and inelastic scatterings in the drain region oil hot carrier transport in a ballistic,silicon n(+)-i-n(+) diode by the semiclassical Monte Carlo Simulation. In a ballistic diode, elastic scattering Such as that of intravalley acoustic phonons and ionized impurity scattering cause the backward flow of hot electrons from the drain into the channel and severely degrades the mean velocity in the channel region and steady-state current. On the other hand, inelastic scattering such as that of intervalley optical phonons suppresses the backward flow caused by elastic scattering because the kinetic energy of hot electons is lost in the scattering. That is, inelastic scattering increases the ballisticity of the device. We conclude that the scattering and energy relaxation of' hot electrons in the drain region seriously influence the carrier transport in the ballistic diode.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS BRIEF COMMUNICATIONS & REVIEW PAPERS

description.en: We have investigated the effects of elastic and inelastic scatterings in the drain region oil hot carrier transport in a ballistic,silicon n(+)-i-n(+) diode by the semiclassical Monte Carlo Simulation. In a ballistic diode, elastic scattering Such as that of intravalley acoustic phonons and ionized impurity scattering cause the backward flow of hot electrons from the drain into the channel and severely degrades the mean velocity in the channel region and steady-state current. On the other hand, inelastic scattering such as that of intervalley optical phonons suppresses the backward flow caused by elastic scattering because the kinetic energy of hot electons is lost in the scattering. That is, inelastic scattering increases the ballisticity of the device. We conclude that the scattering and energy relaxation of' hot electrons in the drain region seriously influence the carrier transport in the ballistic diode.

paper_title.en: New Monte Carlo simulation technique for quasi-ballistic transport in ultrasmall metal oxide semiconductor field-effect transistors

description.en: A new Monte Carlo simulation technique considering the uncertainty relation and the Pauli principle is proposed for analyzing a quasi-ballistic metal oxide semiconductor field-effect transistor (MOSFET). Instead of the conventional phase space that consists of continuous position and momentum, a discrete phase space represented by a complete basis set of the state vector is employed. The carrier dynamics in the device are analyzed using the Monte Carlo simulation framework, in which a possible transition among numerous probabilistic transitions between these discrete states is selected using random numbers. The technique is applied to a 90nm MOSFET. Analysis shows how the phonon scattering disturbs the ballistic transport, and yields a result that the backscattered flux due to phonon scattering amounts to 27% of the original carrier flux injected from the source for the device.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS BRIEF COMMUNICATIONS & REVIEW PAPERS
